heh', 'score': 1}, {'author': 'banditx19', 'body': 'I was thinking more Twilight but this is good too.', 'score': 1}, {'author': 'Stone_d_', 'body': "I think what they're really talking about is each other, and their respective abilities to sway public opinion on matters like AI, specifically AI. Awhile back Musk founded OpenAI, and made a big stink about the dangers of secrecy with AI. Musk, for awhile, has been proposing that AI is a special case that should be handled with care. Zuckerberg, on the other hand, doesn't want people to be scared of AI. Musk is a powerful voice and maybe some of Facebook's clients heard Musk. I think Mark Zuckerberg knows there's potential dangers in AI just as well as Musk, and he's probably alright with Elon having the last word here. People should take caution with this technology, but they shouldn't be afraid to forge new and exciting paths. 

", 'score': 1}]
